text:
Facial trauma in women resulting from violence by men.
 In a 2 1/2-year period, 546 women with facial injuries were treated.
 In 8.2%, the injury was related to some form of violence exerted by a man.
 In cases where the individual was known, it was usually the husband or boyfriend (almost 67%).
 The assault consisted of a beating with the hands in over 70% of the cases.
 Fracture of the mandible was the most common injury.
 There were also 62 cases of home accidents.
